comment: Avoid taking his class. Quizzes are easy, and from the book/slides. Exams are medium level difficulty. But projects are extremely hard, time taking and he does very tough grading. He is not willing to help his students in these projects and no extra credit.

The worst professor I have ever taken. 3.95 gpa btw. It's March 26th and the professor has yet to instruct us. Like we don't even have a professor. We are given one powerpoint per module, that doesn't even contain quiz questions. We must then take the lockdown quiz as our only form of practice. Then exams with webcam. I would give a 0 if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Prof. Fulford is supportive and encourages questions, but his answers are vague and unhelpful. Doesn't post rubrics and is a tough project grader (Hint: ISSP  BYOD). Weekly quizzes (Lockdown browser) are randomly specific and are harder to study for than the midterm/final (MC and LockDown cam). Tough class but it's 3000-level. Wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Do you enjoy feeling lost? If so, this professor is for you. Projects There are vague and contradicting instructions on an extremely heavy term project (plan 40ish hours). Even though the instructions are extremely confusing, he grades incredibly harsh and expects extremely specific things. Feedback is generic and non-helpful. Exams lol, good luck

A professor should be employed if they don't do any teaching. None of the learning material comes from this professor just a book, audio lectures, and slides he didnt make, so wtf is he being paid to do. This professor is one of the many examples of how the CYBR program at KSU simply doesn't care if there students learn anything or have any quality
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: 4 Week Summer CYBR4330 (Accelerated). 3 Chapters a week. Read and take notes on 1 chapter a day and you'll pass the quiz (Lockdown no cam). Exam follows quiz structure (lockdown w/ cam). All answers are taken from the text book. Discussion posts every week. HW grading is a little strict, no rubric to go by. Keep up with the work, and you'll pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: if you have any option, never take this professor. he gives projects with the most vague instructions then proceeds to take points off for extremely specific instances. RM project takes hours of tedious input for him to grade you extremely specific on it. if you can take any other professor possible, do it.

Quiz for every chapter, in lockdown w/o camera. 2 tests with webcam. Plan of study(easy), Policy Project(moderately difficult), and the risk management project (difficult). The RM project is extremely long and hard to follow along with. Definitely do NOT procrastinate. Prof is okay, only prob is, he didn't make the content. So take it how you may

Small list of the worst professor. Got a B after he gave insane amounts of extra credit bc everyone was failing. He is almost never available & does not respond to emails unless he wants to. He has another full time job & this is clearly 2nd. Test are insanely hard and use webcam. Graded the big project on stuff that was NOT in the rubric. RUN.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader
